headline: China tariffs, Delta earnings, Fed commentary: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton examines what Wall Street will be watching on Wednesday, April 9. US President Trump's 104% tariffs on imports from China are set to take effect at midnight. Delta Air (DAL) will report first quarter earnings before the opening bell, and Constellation Brands (STZ) will announce earnings results after market close. Richmond Federal Reserve president Tom Barkin will speak, offering fresh commentary from the central bank. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

Richmond Federal Reserve president Tom Barkin will speak, offering fresh commentary from the central bank. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Beer maker Constellation Brands pulls back DEI initiatives
summary: In January, Trump issued an executive order that directed federal agencies to terminate DEI programs and urged private companies to end "illegal DEI discrimination and preferences." Over the past year, major companies including Walmart, Target and Amazon.com have rolled back their DEI policies, aimed at women, ethnic minorities, LGBTQ+ people and other traditionally underrepresented groups. The brewer renamed its DEI team to inclusive culture team and changed its supplier diversity program to now focus on local small businesses instead of diverse suppliers, according to a statement by CEO Bill Newlands on its website.
